alert.note: Alert for Iron; Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 01 at 4:48PM MST until January 01 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN IRON, WEST CENTRAL KANE AND EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 448 PM MST, Park rangers reported flash flooding in Zion National Park. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Park rangers reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, canyons, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
